titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Brian Carpenter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:15-0400

did.unittitle: Study of Arapaho tonal phonology
did.abstract: Linguistic field recordings of elicited Arapaho grammar, verbs, adjectives, adverbs, kinship terms, personal names, and general vocabulary. Also includes anecdotes and stories given in Arapaho and English from the consultant's childhood, and about her grandfather and late 19th-century Arapaho history in Oklahoma. Recorded in Watonga, Oklahoma.
did.physdesc: 27 sound cassettes (23 hr., 52 min.) : analog, 1 7/8 ips, stereo.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted access. Requires permission of Berkeley Language Center, University of California, Berkeley.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Presented by William Weigel in 1996 in form of audiocassette copies of original tapes prepared by the Berkeley Language Center, University of California, Berkeley. This material was recorded with the assistance of a Phillips Fund grant.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Orignal tapes held at the Berkeley Language Center, University of California, Berkeley.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Researcher's project report, notes on tape duplication from Berkeley Language Center, and transcript from recording sessions available in the Phillips Fund Collection (Mss.497.3.Am4).

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The recordings held at the APS library are 27 60-minute cassettes that were copied from the collector's original 23 90-minute cassettes. Some of the collector's original tapes are not included on the copies held at the APS Library: tape 2, side B; tape 5, side B; tape 7, sides A and B; tape 15, side B.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Contents of tapes 15 and 16 are identical.

did.unittitle: Audio recordings
Arapaho animal names & other nouns [1 of 2]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Original tapes held at Berkeley Language Center, University of California, Berkeley. This program is a copy of the Language Center tape 1:1, collector's original tape 1, side A.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Audiocassette) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

did.unittitle: Transcription & glossing session for Arapaho stories [4 of 9]: The Peach Tree; How Sitting Bull Quit the Rain Dance

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Transcription and glossing session of previously recorded Arapaho stories played back. This program contains the stories "The Peach Tree" and "How Sitting Bull Quit the Rain Dance." The Sitting Bull referred to is the consultant's grandfather, unrelated to the Hunkpapa Lakota leader Sitting Bull. Original tapes held at Berkeley Language Center, University of California, Berkeley. This program is a copy of the Language Center tape 24:1, collector's original tape 22, side A.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note

did.unittitle: Transcription & glossing session for Arapaho stories [8 of 9]: The Death of James Blindy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Transcription and glossing session of previously recorded Arapaho stories played back. This program contains the story "The Death of James Blindy." Original tapes held at Berkeley Language Center, University of California, Berkeley. This program is a copy of the Language Center tape 26:2, collector's original tape 23, side A.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Audiocassette) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

did.unittitle: Transcription & glossing session for Arapaho stories [9 of 9]: The Death of James Blindy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Transcription and glossing session of previously recorded Arapaho stories played back. This program contains the story "The Death of James Blindy." Original tapes held at Berkeley Language Center, University of California, Berkeley. This program is a copy of the Language Center tape 26:3, collector's original tape 23, side B.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Audiocassette) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.
